metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7495 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
fs/ext4/inode.c in the Linux kernel before 4.6.2, when ext4 data=orderedmode is used, mishandles a needs-flushing-before-commit list, which allowslocal users to obtain sensitive information from other users' files inopportunistic circumstances by waiting for a hardware reset, creating a newfile, making write system calls, and reading this file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7495` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-93-generic - 4.4.0-93.116
